intro: Camissonia acuminata, commonly known as the narrowleaf camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces delicate, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Camissonia acuminata is often found in California and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean climates.
